page.title: 03FARMING HEDLEY WEST HOUSE
page.content: {HEDLEY WEST HOUSE FARM}lies a few miles N.of the Causey Arch,just off the main A6076 road.The tenant bought the farm in 1977 from the Bowes Lyon Estate.This farm of 180 acres has been worked by the same family for 32 years It's a mixed arable farm.Crops include potatoes,turnips,cabbages,carrots, onions,sprouts,tomatoes,wheat,barley and corn.They have 60 beef stock,2 horses,3 goats, 70 free range hens,a peacock,a peahen,and 3 sheep dogs. { }Being a small family farm everything on the farm is utilized and they are able to service the land by keeping hedges and trees in trim and so avoid erosion of the land. The family felt that small farms were better for the conservation of farming and land preservation in the country.Neither of them liked the idea of"factory farms".
